docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 13 -The Senate Finance Committee voted today to raise Social Security taxes next year as it completed work on the most far-reaching and costly pension and welfare bill in the nation's history.

headline.main: PENSION TAX RISE IN 1973 APPROVED BY SENATE PANEL; Finance Committee Finishes Work on Measure Raising Social Security Benefits

docs.abstract: Sen Finance Com votes on June 13 to raise Soc Security taxes in 73 as it completes work on most costly and far-reaching pension and welfare bill in US history; bill would increase most Soc Security benefits by 10% and increase Soc Security taxes 10%; com votes to finance benefit increases by raising both Soc Security tax rate and wage base on which tax is paid, effective next Jan 1; tax rate would be increased from present 5.2% to 5.7%, rate to be paid by both employers and employes; wage base would be increased to $10,200 from present $9,000; workers earning $10,200 or more next yr would have to pay total Soc Security tax of $581.40, up $113.40 from '72; other Soc Security changes detailed
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 13 -The Senate Finance Committee voted today to raise Social Security taxes next year as it completed work on the most far-reaching and costly pension and welfare bill in the nation's history.

docs.lead_paragraph: A boy in the eighth grade listened intently to a school lesson outlining the effect of diet on heart disease.

headline.main: Health Experts, Giving Up on Peers, Take Their Case to Eighth Graders

docs.abstract: Article on curriculum offered to 8th graders at Shenendehowa Central School Dist, Albany, NY, notes program includes courses on effects of drug abuse
docs.snippet: A boy in the eighth grade listened intently to a school lesson outlining the effect of diet on heart disease.
